lead_paragraph: The envoy, Staffan de Mistura, said the talks in Geneva, aimed at a general cease-fire, would be “uphill” and declined to identify who was invited.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.
byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and SOMINI SENGUPTA

snippet: The envoy, Staffan de Mistura, said the talks in Geneva, aimed at a general cease-fire, would be “uphill” and declined to identify who was invited.

headline.main: U.N. Envoy for Syria Says Peace Talks Will Begin Friday
headline.print_headline: Delayed Syrian Peace Talks Are Scheduled to Begin on Friday, U.N. Says

abstract: United Nations sets new date for Geneva peace talks aimed at resolving conflict in Syria; offers no details on crucial questions of which opposition groups would be invited to table, or about future role of Pres Bashar al-Assad.
